title: Riots in Uttar Pradesh: After Dadri lynching, mob targets four accused of cow slaughter in Agra
text:
Riots in Uttar Pradesh: After Dadri lynching, mob targets four accused of cow slaughter in Agra By Priya Prakashan on October 10, 2015 at 10:38 AM Comments 
In yet another shocking incident, an angry tried to lynch four men accused of killing and skinning a cow in Uttar Pradesh. This incident took place in Mainpuri district near Agra, Uttar Pradesh. Those four men who were accused got injured and two of them have been hospitalized as they are in critical condition. 
Twenty one people have been arrested in this Agra slaughter case. The incident took a violent turn as the mob set ablaze about a dozen shops and also gutted two police vehicles injuring around seven security personnel. 
The violence was triggered when group of people said that four men were seen skinning a cow early morning. As soon as the crowd came to know about this speculation, they went looking and spotted four spotted with the cow. Two managed to escape while two others were battered. 
Later it was found out that the the cow died of natural causes and the owner hired the men to remove its skin to sell it to a tannery. But the angry mob were out on the streets with metal rods, bamboo sticks and guns. They demanded instant public justice be served to the men involved in killing the cow. 
Apparently the son of the cowâ€™s owner had spread rumours about the slaughter, which triggered the violence by the mob, both the father and son are wanted in the case. An FIR has been filed against the men charged with killing the bovine. Aother has been filed against around 500 unidentified men for triggering riots when Section 144 of CrPC was already imposed.
